title: How to Copy Drivers from One Computer to Another on PC or Mac

steps.title: Open the Windows File Explorer.
steps.content: Open the Windows File Explorer. A fast way to do this is to press the Windows ⊞ Win + e on the keyboard. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Navigate to driver repository.
steps.content: Navigate to driver repository. Windows stores a copy of each installed driver at C:\Windows\System32\DriverStore\FileRepository. [2] X Research source Each driver is located within its own folder. To access this folder, click your C drive in the left panel, double-click Windows , then System32 , then DriverStore , and then FileRepository .

steps.title: Locate the folder with the driver you want to copy.
steps.content: Locate the folder with the driver you want to copy. Scroll down the right panel until you find it. Folders names begin with the name of the actual driver (e.g., ″xboxgip.if_amd64_x″), and are listed in alphabetical order by default.

steps.title: Copy the folder to a flash drive.
steps.content: Copy the folder to a flash drive. If you don’t have a flash drive, you can zip the folder up and upload it to a cloud server, such as Google Drive . Otherwise, here’s how to copy the folder to your flash drive: [3] X Research source Insert your flash drive into the computer. Click the folder you want to copy once to select it, then press Ctrl + C to copy it. Scroll down the left column of the File Explorer and double-click your flash drive. Right-click a blank space in the right panel and select Paste . Once the files are copied, safely remove your flash drive.

steps.title: Insert the flash drive into the second PC.
steps.content: Insert the flash drive into the second PC. If the contents of the flash drive do not display immediately, press ⊞ Win + E to open the File Explorer, then click the flash drive to open it. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you uploaded the folder to a cloud account, sign into that same account on this computer, then download the file.

steps.title: Drag the driver folder to the desktop.
steps.content: Drag the driver folder to the desktop. You can drag it to a different location on the computer if you prefer. If you downloaded a zip file, double-click it to open it, then drag the folder inside to the desktop.

steps.title: Open the Device Manager.
steps.content: Open the Device Manager. Here’s how to find it: [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Click the search icon (a circle or magnifying glass next to the Start menu). Type device . Click Device Manager when it appears in the search results.

steps.title: Expand the group that contains the device you want to install.
steps.content: Expand the group that contains the device you want to install. Depending on the device, the correct group may already be expanded because the driver needs to be installed. For example, if you’re installing the driver for a sound card, expand ″Sound, Video, and game controllers″ group.

steps.title: Right-click the device and select Properties.
steps.content: Right-click the device and select Properties . This opens the Properties window.

steps.title: Click the Driver tab.
steps.content: Click the Driver tab. It’s at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Browse my computer for driver software.
steps.content: Click Browse my computer for driver software . It’s the second option.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse .

steps.title: Double-click the location where you copied the driver folder.
steps.content: Double-click the location where you copied the driver folder. For example, if you dragged the folder to the desktop, double-click Desktop .

steps.title: Select the driver folder and click OK.
steps.content: Select the driver folder and click OK . This adds the selected folder to the ″Update Drivers″ dialog. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . Windows will now scan the folder for the driver.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to install the driver.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to install the driver.

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . It’s the first icon on the Dock, which is usually at the bottom of the screen. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Press ⌥ Option as you click Go.
steps.content: Press ⌥ Option as you click Go . Go is a menu in the bar at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Click Library.
steps.content: Click Library .

steps.title: Double-click the device’s folder.
steps.content: Double-click the device’s folder. For example, if you need to copy printer drivers, double-click Printers .

steps.title: Copy the folder to a flash drive.
steps.content: Copy the folder to a flash drive. If you don’t have a flash drive, you can zip the folder up and upload it to a cloud server, such as Google Drive . Otherwise, here’s how to copy the folder to your flash drive: Insert your flash drive into the computer. In a few moments, the flash drive will show up under ″Devices″ in the left column of Finder. [8] X Research source Drag the driver from its original location to the flash drive.

steps.title: Insert the flash drive into the second Mac.
steps.content: Insert the flash drive into the second Mac. If you uploaded the folder to a cloud account, sign into that same account on this computer, download the zip file, and then unzip it to the computer.

steps.title: Open Finder and click the flash drive.
steps.content: Open Finder and click the flash drive. The contents of the drive will appear.

steps.title: Drag the folder to the hard drive.
steps.content: Drag the folder to the hard drive. It’s usually called Macintosh HD unless it’s been renamed. This installs the driver to the appropriate Library folder. [9] X Research source
